gurmukhi: mn mDukrih crx kmln pr huAY mnm`q guMjwrO ] mwqiRk spq spq ipqrn kul cOdhUM kulI auDwrO ]1]75]
transliteration: Man Madhoukarah(i) Charan Kamlan Par Huai Manmatt Gounjaarau|| Maatrik Sapat Sapat Pitran Kul Chaudahoon Kuliudhaarau||1||75||
translation: My mind has become a bumble bee and is humming over the lotus-feet; this being will be redeemed alongwith the fourteen generations of parents and manes (if it meditates on Thy Lotus-Feet).175.

gurmukhi: qw idn dyh sPl kr jwno ] jw idn jgq mwq pRPuilq hÍY dyih ibjY br dwno ]
transliteration: Taa Din Deh Saphal Kar Jaano|| Jaa Din Jagad Maat Praphulit Hvai Deh(i) Bijai Bar Daano||
translation: I shall accept that day fruitful and blessed, on which the mother of the world, getting pleased, will bestow on me the boon of victory;

gurmukhi: qw idn SsqR AsqR kt bwNDo cMdn icqR lgwaUN ] jwkhu nyq ingm kih bolq qws su br jb pwaUN ]2]76]
transliteration: Taa Din Shastra Astra Kat Baandgi Channdan Chitra Lagadoon|| Jaakauh Net Nigad Kah(i) Dolat Taas Su Bar Jab Paaoon||2||76||
translation: On that day I shall fasten the arms and weapons with my waist, and plaster the place with sandal; from her I shall obtain the boon, whom the Vedas etc. call “neti, neti’ (not this, not this).2.76.

gurmukhi: AMqrjwmI ABX BvwnI ] Aiq hI inrK pRym pwrs ko icq kI biRQw pCwnI ]
transliteration: Antarjaamiabhaya Bhavaanee|| At(i) Hinirakh Prem Paaras Ko Chit Kibrithaa Pachhaadee||
translation: The Goddess Bhavani who understands everything contained in the mind, seeing the extreme love of the king Parasnath, understood his mind-thought;

gurmukhi: Awpn Bgq jwn BvKMfn ABXs rUp idKwXo ] c`kRq rhy pyK mun jn sur Ajr Amr pd pwXo ]3]77]
transliteration: Aapan Bhagad Jaan Bhavkhanndan Abhayas Roop Dikhaayo|| Chakkrat Rahe Pekh Mounndjan Sur Ajar Amar Pad Paayo||3||77||
translation: Considering him Her devotee, the goddess showed him her fearless form; seeing it all the sages and men were wonder-struck and all of them attained the supreme State.3.77.

gurmukhi: soBq bwmih pwn kiRpwxI ] jw qr j`C ikMnr Asurn kI sB kI kiRXw ihrwnI ]
transliteration: Sobhat Baamah(i) Paan Kridaanee|| Jaa Tar Jachchh Kinnar Asuran Kisabh Dikridaa Hiraanee||
translation: In the left hand of the goddess that sword was there, with which she had destroyed all the Yakshas, demons and Kinnars etc.;

gurmukhi: jw qn mDukItB khu KMfXo suMB insuMB sMGwry ] syeI kiRpwn indwn lgy jg dwhn rho hmwry ]4]78]
transliteration: Jaa Tan Madhu-keetabh Kauh Khandyo Sounbh Nisounbh Sanhdare|| Soikridaan Nidaan Lage Jag Daahan Raho Hamdare||4||78||
translation: The same sword had killed Madhu-Kaitabh and Shumbh-Nishumbh. O Lord ! the same sword may ever be on my left side i.e. I may wear it.4.78.

gurmukhi: jwq n ibVwlwC icCRwidk KMfn KMf auTwey ] DUlIkrn DUmRlocn ky mwsn ig`D rjwey ]
transliteration: Jaat Na Bidaalaachh Chichhraadik Khanndan Khanndouthaae|| Dhooleekaran Dhoomralochan Ke Maasan Giddh Rajaae||
translation: Biralaksh, Chakshrasura etc. were torn into bits and with the same sword, the flesh of Dhumar Lochan was caused to be eaten by the vultures to their fill;

gurmukhi: rwm rsUl ikSn ibSnwidk kwl kÍwlih kUty ] kot aupwie Dwie sB Qwky ibn iqh Bjn n CUty ]5]79]
transliteration: Raam Rasool Kishan Bishnaadik Kaal Kravaalah(i) Koote|| Kot Oupaae Dhaae Sabh Thaake Bin Tih Bhajan Na Chhodhte||5||79||
translation: Ram, Muhammad, Krishna, Vishnu etc., All were destroyed by this sword of KAL; crores of measures, but without the devotion of One Lord, no one achieved redemption.5.79.
